page.title: 12THE GUIDED BUS ERDINGTON
page.content: Before the 1950's public road transport in the area was by tram. They had an overhead cable which had electricity running through it. They ran on tracks which were sunk into the ground. They turned over to buses for public transport in the 50's. The bus did not have to run on tracks and was powered by a diesel engine. They are mainly double-deckers but some of the buses were single-deckers. On later buses instead of getting on at the back of the bus you get on at the front. When the bus stops the driver opens the doors automatically. In 1984 they tried an experiment which is a kind of bus called "Tracline 65" which ran along tracks and normal roads. The bus had 2 arms which fitted to the side of the tracks. The driver could take his hands off the steering wheel but he doesn't for safety reasons.
